NDFSK meets to grandly celebrate February holiday
articles.content:
NDFSK meets to grandly celebrate February holiday 
    Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The central committee  of the National Democratic Front of South Korea on Feb. 8 released a communique on the enlarged meeting of its presidium held on the occasion of the birthday of leader Kim Jong Il, the Seoul-based voice of national salvation reported.
 According to the communique, the meeting discussed an agenda "on grandly celebrating the birthday of the great leader general Kim Jong Il as the greatest holiday of the nation."    
 It was decided at the meeting that the ndfsk central committee would send a congratulatory message to Kim Jong Il on the occasion of his birthday and multifarious events be held in the celebration period from Feb. 10 to 20, the voice of national salvation arrange a special program and other media carry special write-ups.

articles.content:
DPRK women paddlers prove successful in table-tennis tournament 
    Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Women paddlers of the DPRK proved successful in the English open table-tennis tournament.
 Kim Hyon Hui and Kim Hyang Mi came first in women's doubles and Kim Yun Mi in under 21 women's singles.    
 Kim Hyon Hui came second in women's singles.

Gift to Kim Jong Il from Chinese organization
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Chinese organization 
    Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received a gift from the china ice sports association on the occasion of his birthday.
 The gift was handed to an official concerned by the head of the Chinese figure-skating team participating in the tenth International Figure Skating Festival for Paektusan Cup.

articles.title: Floral baskets and congratulatory letters to Kim Jong Il from foreign diplomats
articles.content:
Floral baskets and congratulatory letters to Kim Jong Il from foreign diplomats 
    Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The diplomatic corps and the economic and commercial councillors corps here today presented floral baskets and congratulatory letters to leader Kim Jong Il on the occasion of his birthday.
 The baskets and letters were conveyed to foreign minister paek nam sun and an official concerned by Palestinian ambassador Shaher Mohammed Abdlah who is doyen of the diplomatic corps and trade counsellor of the russian embassy Sergei Lyoushikin who is doyen of the economic and commercial councillors corps.

articles.title: DPRK Olympic delegation leaves
articles.content:
DPRK Olympic delegation leaves 
    Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- An Olympic delegation of the DPRK led by Jang Ung, vice-chairman of the DPRK Olympic Committee who is member of the International Olympic Committee, left here today by train to participate in the Olympic festival which will be held in Moscow.

articles.title: Greetings to prime minister of Thailand
articles.content:
Greetings to prime minister of Thailand
    Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Hong Song Nam, premier of the DPRK cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Thaksin Shinawatra upon his appointment as prime minister of Thailand.
 Convinced that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to strengthen and develop on good terms, the message sincerely wished him great success in his work.
